title: 2023 NCAT VR4 Receiver Offloads
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG to listen for acoustically tagged animals and offload data from bottom-mounted Innovasea VR4 receivers. 

The glider was also equipped with float mounted Airmar 200WX weather station, Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor, and Seabird GPCTD and dissolved oxygen sensor, as well as two sub-mounted Innovasea VMTs with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. Two APUs were installed for additional power.

This glider had previously completed the ESRF survey and is continuing on to offload data from the NCAT receiver array.

Was supposed to offload the CBS array as well, but the VM4 stopped communicating with the science computer.

raw_relationship.comment: SBE43F integrated with Glider Payload CTD SN 0069

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Serviced by Sea-Bird Dec 2019.
Configured to use Sea-Bird equations (2007 and later):

Calibration Coefficients:
Soc = 3.1429e-004
Foffset = -833.7971
A = -3.5379e-003
B = 1.6218e-004
C = -2.7063e-006
D0 = 2.5826e+000
D1 = 1.92634e-004
D2 = -4.64803e-002
E = 3.6000e-002
Tau20 = 1.0400
H1 = -3.3000e-002
H2 = 5.0000e+003
H3 = 1.4500e+003

raw_relationship.comment: Vemco VM4 mounted in towbody of SV3-1070 for ESRF, NCAT offloads and snow crab survey.

instrument.comment:
VR4-UWM specifically designed to be mounted on a wave glider. Dual receiver channel frequencies - 69 kHz and 180 kHz and benthos underwater modem. 

Towed from the Wave Glider sub on a towfish several meters below water.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1161/

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted to front of SV3-1070 sub with hydrophone head pointing DOWN. Will be out for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and offloads of HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX receivers.

instrument.comment: Tag ID: 54900, MAP-114, set to Always Tx. 60 days (19%) battery remaining

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted to front of SV3-1070 sub with hydrophone head pointing UP. Will be out for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and offloads of HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX receivers.

instrument.comment: Tag ID: 54902, MAP-114, Never Tx. Programmed for high power only, with a random ping interval centered on 2 min (60 – 180s).

raw_data.title: 2023 NCAT VR4 Receiver Offloads
raw_data.comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG to listen for acoustically tagged animals and offload data from bottom-mounted Innovasea VR4 receivers. 

The glider was also equipped with float mounted Airmar 200WX weather station, Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor, Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor, and Seabird GPCTD and dissolved oxygen sensor, as well as two sub-mounted Innovasea VMTs with one hydrophone head pointed up, one hydrophone head pointed down. Two APUs were installed for additional power.

This glider had previously completed the ESRF survey and is continuing on to offload data from the NCAT receiver array.

Was supposed to offload the CBS array as well, but the VM4 stopped communicating with the science computer.

data_logger.name: CCU
data_logger.comment:
vid=531222760, drybox s/n: 009883

Block 2, Regulus 3.3.0

cell modem: MultiTech MultiConnect® Dragonfly™ embedded System-On-Module (PN MTQ-H5-B02), USB 2.0. Robust antenna utilizes Laird™TRA6927M3PBN-001 in robust enclosure, mounted to a 0.5m mast.
SIM: need to check

Sent to LRI Jan 2024 for Block 2 and Regulus upgrades.

raw_relationship.comment: Electromagnetic water speed sensor mounted thru-hull of SV3-1070. Capable of measuring water speed and temperature. Connects to the CCU.

instrument.long_name: Airmar DX900+ MultiLog (electromagnetic)  water speed sensor
instrument.comment: Electromagnetic - MultiLog Sensor - capable of measuring speed and temperature. Mounted at the forward end of the forward payload bay of Wave Glider, thru hull. Provides water speed input to the core vehicle.

instrument.comment:
Iridium 9603 modem with a NAL Research Dual Iridium / GPS antenna (PN SAF4070-IG). 
Mounted inside SV3-1070 CCU drybox s/n 009883.

IMEI: 300434064026230

Made the serial number the IMEI for now.

raw_relationship.comment: WX mounted on 1m mast attached to float of SV3-1070. Will be used for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX offload missions.

instrument.comment:
Passes testing for IPX-6 heavy seas water standards. 1.2 m in height (mounted on top of 1.0 m mast).

Operating temperature range: -25 to 55 degrees C

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1032/

raw_relationship.comment: Planned to move away from having vehicle specific data reports as instruments on flight computer. Put all parameters directly onto flight computer.

instrument.comment:
Telemetry reported by wave glider command and control unit (CCU). This is the serial number of SV3-1070 Wave Glider CCU.

I think we plan to set this up differently now. Putting everything listed as sensor below as parameters directly on flight computer.

sensor.comment:
Measured by Airmar DX900+ Multilog Smart Electromagnetic Speed Sensor thru-hull.

Transverse Speed Range: +/- 6 knots
Longitudinal Speed Range: +/- 60 knots

LRI data output in kt/1000, but should be converted to m/s for standard unit.

I think we plan to set this up differently now. Putting everything listed as sensor below as parameters directly on flight computer.

sensor.comment: This is the float heading, as measured by the Airmar WX200 weather station.

sensor.comment: Estimated speed of the ocean current based on measurements by the Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor and movement of the wave glider (GPS).

sensor.comment: Estimated flow direction of the ocean current.

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:
3MPU for SV3-1070. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)

raw_relationship.comment: GPCTD + DO mounted under SV3-1070 float for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX offloads.

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:
3MPU for SV3-1070. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)

raw_relationship.comment: SBE43F integrated with Glider Payload CTD SN 0069

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Serviced by Sea-Bird Dec 2019.
Configured to use Sea-Bird equations (2007 and later):

Calibration Coefficients:
Soc = 3.1429e-004
Foffset = -833.7971
A = -3.5379e-003
B = 1.6218e-004
C = -2.7063e-006
D0 = 2.5826e+000
D1 = 1.92634e-004
D2 = -4.64803e-002
E = 3.6000e-002
Tau20 = 1.0400
H1 = -3.3000e-002
H2 = 5.0000e+003
H3 = 1.4500e+003

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment: (Legacy) SBE 05M Submersible Pump

raw_relationship.comment: Vemco VM4 mounted in towbody of SV3-1070 for ESRF, NCAT offloads and snow crab survey.

instrument.comment:
VR4-UWM specifically designed to be mounted on a wave glider. Dual receiver channel frequencies - 69 kHz and 180 kHz and benthos underwater modem. 

Towed from the Wave Glider sub on a towfish several meters below water.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1161/

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:

instrument.comment:
LRI GPSWaves software receives selected inputs from: the 1Hz GPS included with the Wave Glider system and a LORD Microstrain GPS-Aided Inertial Navigation System (GPS/INS) device.

LORD Microstrain serial number: 6251-4220.102126

instrument.long_name: Xeos Rover Iridium Based Surface Beacon
instrument.comment:
vid 791638888

IMEI: 300434064409950

Operating temperature -40 to +60 degC

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted to front of SV3-1070 sub with hydrophone head pointing DOWN. Will be out for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and offloads of HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX receivers.

instrument.comment: Tag ID: 54900, MAP-114, set to Always Tx. 60 days (19%) battery remaining

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted to front of SV3-1070 sub with hydrophone head pointing UP. Will be out for ESRF and HaliBT surveys and offloads of HaliBT, Gully, SIA and HFX receivers.

instrument.comment: Tag ID: 54902, MAP-114, Never Tx. Programmed for high power only, with a random ping interval centered on 2 min (60 – 180s).
